thread.title: Radiohead announce U.S. tour with two dates in Berkeley
thread.title_full: Radiohead announce U.S. tour with two dates in Berkeley

author: Alyssa Pereira
title: Radiohead announce U.S. tour with two dates in Berkeley
text:
Radiohead announce U.S. tour with two dates in Berkeley 1 / 12 Back to Gallery 
Elusive Brit rockers Radiohead will make a couple rare non-festival appearances in the Bay Area this April. 
The spring dates, which are scheduled between their two weekend headlining spots at the Coachella music festival in Southern California, will take place April 17 and 18, 2017 at the Greek Theatre in Berkeley. 
Radiohead last played in the Bay Area for the Outside Lands Music Festival in August 2016 . During their headlining Saturday night set, the band largely played cuts from their most recent album, "A Moon Shaped Pool," and some numbers from their lengthy back catalog. 
The 18th annual Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival released its lineup this afternoon, with the headliners being Radiohead, Beyoncé and Kendrick Lamar. Other notable artists performing are Travis Scott, Dillon Francis, Mac Miller, Future, Lorde and DJ Khaled. Coachella has risen to international fame over the past decade due to its location and ability to get a wide range of artists. The festival will be April 14-16 and April 21-23. Media: Wibbitz 
Tickets for the upcoming shows at the Greek will go on sale for $95 each on Friday, January 20 at 10 a.m. at Ticketmaster .
